intro: Aeschynomene mollicula var. breviflora, commonly known as the short-flowered velvetleaf, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the legume family, Fabaceae, and is characterized by its hairy, ovate leaves and small, clustered flowers. The plant typically grows as an annual herb, reaching heights of up to 1 meter. It is often found in disturbed soils and can thrive in a variety of environmental conditions. Its seeds are encased in a pod and are dispersed by wind, contributing to its widespread distribution.
